description.narrative:
Project "Facilitating justice access to marriage and family, gender equality and prevention of domestic violence issues for poor communities and ethnic minorities in Quang Binh" contributes in: #Aiming to decrease domestic violence by 50% and cases thatviolate marriage and family law by 60% #Developing a voluntary legal aid consultantcy team #Assisting at least 95% of domestic violence casesand law violations against ethnic minority women and girls when discovered in the community
Specific activities include: # Organizing trainings on counseling and communication skills for counselors on gender equality law, domestic violence prevention law, marriage - family law and related international conventions # Completing procedures and register to establish a voluntary legal consultancy team under Article 15 of the Law on Legal Aid 2017 # Developing propaganda materials for ethnic minority communities on Gender Equality law, domestic violence prevention law, Marriage and Family Law. # Conducting needs assessment for legal aid on the topics of gender equality law, domestic violence prevention law, marriage and family law # Building websites for inquiries on legal information and legal advice # Organizing legal aid activities in the community everyquarter. # Providing legal counseling at offices, phone counseling, online counseling # Studying the impact of legal aid policy on the topics of gender equality law, domestic violence prevention law, marriage and family law # Organizing policy advocacyworkshop on gender equality, domestic violence, marriage and family law # Organizing and integrating legal aid plans with the Department of Justice into its workshop # Organizing workshop on sharing legal counseling experience

participating-org.narrative: Quang Ninh Rural Development and Poverty Reduction Fund (RDPR)

Quang Ninh district Rural Development and Poverty Reduction Fund, called Development Fund (RDPR) was founded under the Decision No.182/Q#-UB dated 03 July 2003 issued by People#s Committee of Quang Ninh district, Quang Binh province. The function of the Quang Ninh district Development Fund is to mobilize aid and donations from national and international organizations to implement projects and programs for supporting rural development, community development and poverty reduction.
Until now, RDPR have had more than 10 years of working experience in community development, rural development, and contributing to poverty reduction locally, especially for ethnic minority communities. RDPR Fund has cooperated and received lots of funding resources to implement programs and projects frommany international organizations such as ICCO, DED, GIZ, SEF, OXFAM, Embassy of Australia, etc. RDPR is also the member of many networks of research and society organizations, such as CIFPEN, VRN. The contribution of RDPR to local socio-economic development has received the support of local authorities. RDPR has received certificates of merit from the People's Committee of Quang Binh province in 2012 because of its above achievements. Mr Pham Mau Tai- Director of RDPR Fund has also received certificate of merit of Quang Binh Provincial Party Executive Committee on his achievement of 15 years of implementation of the Central Resolution 5 (Course VIII)on the construction and development of culture Vietnam advanced imbued with national identity.
In order to implement its objectives of supporting for disadvantaged communities in coming time, RDPR always enhances its capacity and continues to call funding from organizations and individuals inside and outside Vietnam.
PURPOSE: The Fund contributes to improve living quality of the famers and reducing poverty with its main focus on improving income, heath care services and education for the poor, especially the women and ethnic minority in Quang Ninh district, Quang Binh province by changing their view and strengthen capacity to address and meet theirdaily needs.
OBJECTIVE: Improve capacity for the poor and disadvantaged groups, especially for poor women and ethnic minority to meet their demands on food security, healthcare, sanitation and education. Enhance ability of access to available sources such as credit, agriculture # forestry - fishery extension, health care and education for the poor and disadvantaged groups.
